pageContext.claim: “We have countries that are friends. They have tremendous trade surpluses, and they have barriers that our farmers can't deal in that country. And yet, they'll send us millions of cars and make a fortune.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump complains about tariffs imposed by other countries but the United States supports American farmers with subsidies that other countries complain gives them an unfair competitive advantage. China, for instance, complains that subsidies from the U.S. government have given American soybean farmers an unfair competitive advantage in selling to China. In any case, countries do not make or lose money on trade.
